definition: to bring to justice/to file away (a document)

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: Huang taiji at noon on the second day if the killer is not on the monkey to justice was put to death on her.
sentences.chinese: 皇太极下旨第二日中午如果凶手还不归案就处死玉儿。

sentences.english: Socialist organizations called for the culprits to be hunted down.
sentences.chinese: 社会主义团体呼吁将这些犯人缉拿归案。

sentences.english: The criminal who looted the bank has been hounded down.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫银行的那名罪犯已被捉拿归案了。

sentences.english: He remembered instances in which defaulters had been captured.
sentences.chinese: 他想起一些盗用公款的罪犯被捉拿归案的例子。

sentences.english: Police have charged a man with murder as a hate crime in her death.
sentences.chinese: 警方抓捕了一名男子，并以仇杀罪名将其归案。

sentences.english: The police have already arrested the bank robber.
sentences.chinese: 警察已经把银行抢劫犯抓捕归案。

sentences.english: A fourth pirate was captured in the operation on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 第四名海盗在周日的行动中被抓捕归案。

sentences.english: We find them; we take them as a team and we bring them back.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到他们，把他们一网打尽，捉拿归案。

sentences.english: Last July, the local police arrested Luo and Xu.
sentences.chinese: 去年6月，当地警方将罗某与许某逮捕归案。

sentences.english: Catching the " Gang of Four " at one stroke.
sentences.chinese: 一举把“四人帮”捉拿归案。

sentences.english: The law will haunt them until they are caught.
sentences.chinese: 法律将追查到底，直到把他们抓捕归案。

sentences.english: The police said that it was just a matter of time before the murderer was put into prison.
sentences.chinese: 警方表示，将杀人凶手缉拿归案只是个时间问题。

sentences.english: The police are tying to round up the jewel thieves and bring them to justice.
sentences.chinese: 警察正在设法将盗窃珠宝的窃贼捉拿归案。

sentences.english: According to the authentic news , the grafter has been arrested.
sentences.chinese: 据可靠消息，那名贪污犯已被捉拿归案。

sentences.english: The robbers haven't been sloughed up yet.
sentences.chinese: 犯抢劫的案犯还没有被捉拿归案。

sentences.english: The criminal was seized by the police.

definition: to make an appearance in court
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to be at large (of a criminal)
to commit a crime or offence
to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
